Course Description: AN EXAMINATION OF BUDGETING, ACCOUNTING, REPORTING STANDARDS AND PRACTICES FOR GOVERNMENTAL, NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES, COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, HOSPITALS, AND OTHER HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.	IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN THE CHARACTERISTICS THAT DISTINGUISH GOVERNMENTAL, NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES, COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, HOSPITALS, AND OTHER HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS FROM PROFIT ENTITIES.
2.	IDENTIFY THE AUTHORITATIVE BODIES RESPONSIBLE FOR SETTING FINANCIAL REPORTING STANDARDS FOR GOVERNMENTAL, NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES, COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, HOSPITALS, AND OTHER HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS.
3.	CONTRAST AND COMPARE THE OBJECTIVES OF FINANCIAL REPORTING FOR GOVERNMENTAL, NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES, COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, HOSPITALS, AND OTHER HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS.
4.	EXPLAIN HOW MANAGEMENT DISCUSSING AND ANALYSIS, BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND REPORTING SUPPLEMENTARY INFORMATION OF STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS RELATE TO THEIR COMPREHENSIVE ANNUAL FINANCIAL REPORTS.
5.	EXPLAIN THE DIFFERENT OBJECTIVES, MEASUREMENT FOCUS, AND BASIS OF ACCOUNTING OF THE GOVERNMENT-WIDE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FUND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS.
Textbook(s): COPLEY: ESSENTIALS OF ACCOUNTING FOR GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, 13E, MCGRAW HILL
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
